trans-unit.source: Writing a custom DSC resource with PowerShell classes
trans-unit.target: Writing a custom DSC resource with PowerShell classes

trans-unit.source: Applies To: Windows Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Windows Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: With the introduction of PowerShell classes in Windows PowerShell 5.0, you can now define a DSC resource by creating a class.
trans-unit.target: With the introduction of PowerShell classes in Windows PowerShell 5.0, you can now define a DSC resource by creating a class.

trans-unit.source: The class defines both the schema and the implementation of the resource, so there is no need to create a separate MOF file.
trans-unit.target: The class defines both the schema and the implementation of the resource, so there is no need to create a separate MOF file.

trans-unit.source: The folder structure for a class-based resource is also simpler, because a **DSCResources** folder is not necessary.
trans-unit.target: The folder structure for a class-based resource is also simpler, because a **DSCResources** folder is not necessary.

trans-unit.source: In a class-based DSC resource, the schema is defined as properties of the class which can be modified with attributes to specify the property type..
trans-unit.target: In a class-based DSC resource, the schema is defined as properties of the class which can be modified with attributes to specify the property type..

trans-unit.source: The resource is implemented by **Get()**, **Set()**, and **Test()** methods (equivalent to the **Get-TargetResource**, **Set-TargetResource**, and **Test-TargetResource** functions in a script resource.
trans-unit.target: The resource is implemented by **Get()**, **Set()**, and **Test()** methods (equivalent to the **Get-TargetResource**, **Set-TargetResource**, and **Test-TargetResource** functions in a script resource.

trans-unit.source: In this topic, we will create a simple resource named **FileResource** that manages a file in a specified path.
trans-unit.target: In this topic, we will create a simple resource named **FileResource** that manages a file in a specified path.

trans-unit.source: For more information about DSC resources, see [Build Custom Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration Resources](authoringResource.md)
trans-unit.target: For more information about DSC resources, see [Build Custom Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration Resources](authoringResource.md)

trans-unit.source: Folder structure for a class resource
trans-unit.target: Folder structure for a class resource

trans-unit.source: To implement a DSC custom resource with a PowerShell class, create the following folder structure.
trans-unit.target: To implement a DSC custom resource with a PowerShell class, create the following folder structure.

trans-unit.source: The class is defined in **MyDscResource.psm1** and the module manifest is defined in **MyDscResource.psd1**.
trans-unit.target: The class is defined in **MyDscResource.psm1** and the module manifest is defined in **MyDscResource.psd1**.

trans-unit.source: Create the class
trans-unit.target: Create the class

trans-unit.source: You use the class keyword to create a PowerShell class.
trans-unit.target: You use the class keyword to create a PowerShell class.

trans-unit.source: To specify that a class is a DSC resource, use the **DscResource()** attribute.
trans-unit.target: To specify that a class is a DSC resource, use the **DscResource()** attribute.

trans-unit.source: The name of the class is the name of the DSC resource.
trans-unit.target: The name of the class is the name of the DSC resource.

trans-unit.source: Declare properties
trans-unit.target: Declare properties

trans-unit.source: The DSC resource schema is defined as properties of the class.
trans-unit.target: The DSC resource schema is defined as properties of the class.

trans-unit.source: We declare three properties as follows.
trans-unit.target: We declare three properties as follows.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the properties are modified by attributes.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the properties are modified by attributes.

trans-unit.source: The meaning of the attributes is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The meaning of the attributes is as follows:

trans-unit.source: **DscProperty(Key)**: The property is required.
trans-unit.target: **DscProperty(Key)**: The property is required.

trans-unit.source: The property is a key.
trans-unit.target: The property is a key.

trans-unit.source: The values of all properties marked as keys must combine to uniquely identify a resource instance within a configuration.
trans-unit.target: The values of all properties marked as keys must combine to uniquely identify a resource instance within a configuration.

trans-unit.source: **DscProperty(Mandatory)**: The property is required.
trans-unit.target: **DscProperty(Mandatory)**: The property is required.

trans-unit.source: **DscProperty(NotConfigurable)**: The property is read-only.
trans-unit.target: **DscProperty(NotConfigurable)**: The property is read-only.

trans-unit.source: Properties marked with this attribute cannot be set by a configuration, but are populated by the **Get()** method when present.
trans-unit.target: Properties marked with this attribute cannot be set by a configuration, but are populated by the **Get()** method when present.

trans-unit.source: **DscProperty()**: The property is configurable, but it is not required.
trans-unit.target: **DscProperty()**: The property is configurable, but it is not required.

trans-unit.source: The **$Path** and **$SourcePath** properties are both strings.
trans-unit.target: The **$Path** and **$SourcePath** properties are both strings.

trans-unit.source: The **$CreationTime** is a [DateTime](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.datetime.aspx) property.
trans-unit.target: The **$CreationTime** is a [DateTime](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.datetime.aspx) property.

trans-unit.source: The **$Ensure** property is an enumeration type, defined as follows.
trans-unit.target: The **$Ensure** property is an enumeration type, defined as follows.

trans-unit.source: Implementing the methods
trans-unit.target: Implementing the methods

trans-unit.source: The **Get()**, **Set()**, and **Test()** methods are analogous to the **Get-TargetResource**, **Set-TargetResource**, and **Test-TargetResource** functions in a script resource.
trans-unit.target: The **Get()**, **Set()**, and **Test()** methods are analogous to the **Get-TargetResource**, **Set-TargetResource**, and **Test-TargetResource** functions in a script resource.

trans-unit.source: This code also includes the CopyFile() function, a helper function that copies the file from **$SourcePath** to **$Path**.
trans-unit.target: This code also includes the CopyFile() function, a helper function that copies the file from **$SourcePath** to **$Path**.

trans-unit.source: The complete file
trans-unit.target: The complete file

trans-unit.source: The complete class file follows.
trans-unit.target: The complete class file follows.

trans-unit.source: Create a manifest
trans-unit.target: Create a manifest

trans-unit.source: To make a class-based resource available to the DSC engine, you must include a **DscResourcesToExport** statement in the manifest file that instructs the module to export the resource.
trans-unit.target: To make a class-based resource available to the DSC engine, you must include a **DscResourcesToExport** statement in the manifest file that instructs the module to export the resource.

trans-unit.source: Our manifest looks like this:
trans-unit.target: Our manifest looks like this:

trans-unit.source: Test the resource
trans-unit.target: Test the resource

trans-unit.source: After saving the class and manifest files in the folder structure as described earlier, you can create a configuration that uses the new resource.
trans-unit.target: After saving the class and manifest files in the folder structure as described earlier, you can create a configuration that uses the new resource.

trans-unit.source: For information about how to run a DSC configuration, see [Enacting configurations](enactingConfigurations.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about how to run a DSC configuration, see [Enacting configurations](enactingConfigurations.md).

trans-unit.source: The following configuration will check to see whether the file at `c:\test\test.txt` exists, and, if not, copies the file from `c:\test.txt` (you should create `c:\test.txt` before you run the configuration).
trans-unit.target: The following configuration will check to see whether the file at `c:\test\test.txt` exists, and, if not, copies the file from `c:\test.txt` (you should create `c:\test.txt` before you run the configuration).
